question: What are you interested in?
What is the issuing State?
What is the executing State?

comment: If possible following questions only for EAW and Regulation

question: Offences: Nature and legal classification of offence, and the applicable statutory provision
Offences: State in which the offence was committed
Do the acts, which the European Arrest Warrant is based on, fall under the definition of Article 2, paragraph 2?
Which is the purpose of the EAW?
Is the offence covered by amnesty in the executing Member State?
Information regarding the identity of the requested person: Name and Forename
Information regarding the identity of the requested person: Nationality
Information regarding the identity of the requested person: Age on the date the offence was allegedly committed
Offences: does the offence constitute a crime under the law of the Executing Member State?
Does any of the following situations apply to the EAW subject, in respect of the same acts on which the EAW is based?
Where the Executing Member State had jurisdiction to start a proceeding in regard of the same acts on which the EAW is based, did any of the following situations occur to the related proceeding?
the offence on the basis of which the European arrest warrant has been issued is punishable by custodial life sentence or life-time detention order
The proceedings related to the offence have come to a sentence that has been execute, is being executed, or that may no longer be executed under the law of the sentencing country?
Is the subject a resident of the Executing Member State?
Information regarding the nationality of the requested person
Does the law of the executing Member State allow prosecution for the offence at issue when committed outside its territory?
Did the EAW subject appear in person at the trial resulting in the decision whose execution is requested under the EAW?
Where the subject did not appear in person at the trial resulting in the decision, did any of the following situation apply to the proceeding held in the issuing Member State?
choices: In due time, the subject was made unequivocally aware of the scheduled trial
In due time, the subject was informed that a decision may have been handed down in his or her absence
The subject had given a mandate to a legal counsellor and was indeed defended by that counsellor at the trial

question: Was the subject personally served with the decision and expressly informed about the right to a retrial, or an appeal

value: If informed_of_right_retrial_appeal result is YES, then open the following multiple choice question

question: Being informed of the right to a retrial, did the person declare any of the follwoing?
choices: the person expressly stated not to contest the decision
the person did not request a retrial or appeal within the applicable time frame

value: If informed_of_right_retrial_appeal result is NO, then open the following multiple choice question

question: If the person was not personally served with the decision, any of the following apply?
choices: will be personally served with it without delay after the surrender and will be expressly informed of his or her right to a retrial, or an appeal, which may lead to the original decision being reversed
will be informed of the time frame within which the person has to request such a retrial or appeal

question: Did the Italian authorities issue, for the same acts, a criminal decree of conviction, or a judgement of no grounds to proceed which is no longer subject to an appeal?
How long has the subject resided continuously in Italy (years)?
Which is the investigative measure to be carried out?
In what type of proceeding was the EIO issued
Is the measure for obtaining information already in the possession of the executing authority?
Is the measure the interception of telecommunications?
Name of the authority which issued the EIO
Type of judicial authority which validated this EIO:
Is the execution of the EIO in constrast with?
Is the execution of the EIO dangerous for?
Does the national law authorize the execution of the EIO?
Is the execution of the EIO contrary to the principle of ne bis in idem?

Has the freezing order been incorrectly transmitted?
